benchmark_details.name: VFLAIR-LLM (Vertical Federated Learning for Large Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: VFLAIR-LLM is a lightweight and extensible Split Learning framework for Large Language Models that enables privacy-preserving inference and fine-tuning in resource-constrained environments. The framework supports various model partitions, tasks, and includes a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating privacy algorithms.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a framework for the private adaptation of Large Language Models under constrained resources using Split Learning.

data.source: Multiple public and custom datasets for various tasks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on prediction performance for classification and generative tasks according to the selected benchmark datasets.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score indicates better performance in the context of the evaluated tasks.
methodology.validation: Training and evaluation across multiple tasks and datasets with specific configurations.
